comment: Dr. Grier has been one of the nicest professors that I have ever taken. While he does lecture straight off of the PowerPoint, he does cover the material in adequate depth, along with vivid illustrations and examples. He is even willing to stay after class as long as needed to answer your questions. You can tell that he truly cares for his students.

Dr. Grier is very nice and knows a lot about anatomy however, the man cannot teach. He just reads odd the power point. His lab practicals are on the tv screen because he is disabled but its not helpful when studying the models. I got an A but I didnt use his lectures. I just went to class to find out what he cut out and studied on my own.

Ive had Dr. Grier for an anatomy lecture and lab and they have both by far been the most stressful classes Ive taken. He is knowledgeable, just not a good teacher. He overloads on info that you will never be tested over and then tests over info he never mentioned. He was useless as a lab professor, he taught nothing or simply didnt show up

Youd have to be crazy to take him. I recieved an A in regular chemistry as well as Organic Chemistry and barely made it out of here with a B. Summer semester goes by very fast and professor Grier is a nice guy but he just cant teach. Simple as that

Grier is great!!! If you have the opportunity to take him do it! He tells you EXACTLY what will be in the exams. He gives flowcharts and study aids. If you fail his course its because you didnt bother trying. He is on your side. You just have to put in the work!

Dr. Grier is the nicest professor I have ever had at KSU. He truly cares for his students and wants to see you succeed. The class itself is difficult and requires a lot of time for studying. He teaches from powerpoints and will tell you exactly what he expects you to know. Attendance isn't mandatory but it is very helpful to show up.

Overall, A & P is a tough course! Definitely come to class and take notes ( I found printing out the power points was less effective). Doing all the online homework assignments was helpful too. Dr. Grier is a really nice professor and is eager to answer questions after class or during office hours.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: We were required to buy an iclicker for this course for participation that we never used, so he ended up just giving everyone the points for participation. He "lectures" straight from the powerpoints, and while reviewing for tests, things he said he would not test us on seemed to always show up on test day. Just get the book and teach yourself.

Dr. Grier is a sweet man. He curved 4 out of 5 tests we had, including the final exam. Final was supposed to be cumulative, but ended up testing over the last unit to make it easier on us. Super understanding, but expects you to grasp the material and apply it. Pre-nursing students will need to know this stuff anyways, so make this class count.

This was his first semester teaching at KSU and I think he did a fine job. I knew there would be some harsh reviews based on our class GroupMe, but in all honesty the student complaining are the ones who didn't put in the work. The text will give you every bit of info you need & pwr pts will supplement that. Don't expect him to hand you your grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Really nice guy but HORRIBLE professor. If you're a nursing major, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Your grade will suffer. 5 tests, all of which are tested on material that you are not taught. In his "review sessions", he tells you not to focus on so many things but it turns out to be everything that is tested. Insanely hard class.

he is such a sweet man but i'm so disappointed with this class. he made us pay for materials we didn't end up using, his lectures are straight from the powerpoints but the tests don't match up with the material he teaches whatsoever, and he's terrible with response times over e-mail. probably will have to end up re-taking this class.

He really is such a nice, caring man. However- he is not a good professor. I spent $130 on unused materials. He takes almost a month to grade MC exams on scantron. The material on the exam does not reflect the PPTs, which he reads straight from. He is very knowledgable in the subject, but lacks the teaching ability. TLDR; Good man. Bad professor.

WHAT A KIND MAN. Seriously so sweet. Tests are powerpoints exactly and you can even find helpful study tools on quizlet. Don't buy clicker or hw website because he will just give you a 100 for it. Always there to help and he will even move a test if you need it. Slow about grades but cmon what teacher isn't. TAKE HIM!! A personal favorite.

Avoid at all costs. He reads straight from the powerpoints and skips a lot of material then tests on it. His test questions are very confusing and next to impossible to get correct with what he teaches in class. He does not grade quickly. Definitely do not take for lab as he is very unreasonable in his grading of the final presentation and rude.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: As a professor, he just isn't good. He reads straight from slides but then says they're all basically not important for the test, so you leave without knowing what you know. Tests were impossible compared to how laidback he made everything seem, and he didn't follow the syllabus at all. Lecture doesn't matter since tests don't follow it at all.

AVOID at all costs! He is so unorganized with grades. Did not put them in until the last week of semester. Reads straight from the power points so no point in attending class. Don't need a textbook, his test don't follow the textbook nor lecture ppt.
